verses.verse: And it came to pass after<WH310> these things<WH1697>, that God<WH430> did tempt<WH5254> Abraham<WH85>, and said<WH559> unto him, Abraham<WH85>: and he said<WH559>, Behold, here I am. Behold: Heb. Behold me

And he said<WH559>, Take now<WH3947> thy son<WH1121>, thine only<WH3173> son Isaac<WH3327>, whom thou lovest<WH157>, and get thee<WH3212> into the land<WH776> of Moriah<WH4179>; and offer him<WH5927> there for a burnt offering<WH5930> upon one<WH259> of the mountains<WH2022> which I will tell<WH559> thee of.

And Abraham<WH85> rose up early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242>, and saddled<WH2280> his ass<WH2543>, and took<WH3947> two<WH8147> of his young men<WH5288> with him, and Isaac<WH3327> his son<WH1121>, and clave<WH1234> the wood<WH6086> for the burnt offering<WH5930>, and rose up<WH6965>, and went<WH3212> unto the place<WH4725> of which God<WH430> had told<WH559> him.
Then on the third<WH7992> day<WH3117> Abraham<WH85> lifted up<WH5375> his eyes<WH5869>, and saw<WH7200> the place<WH4725> afar off<WH7350>.

And Abraham<WH85> said<WH559> unto his young men<WH5288>, Abide<WH3427> ye here with the ass<WH2543>; and I and the lad<WH5288> will go<WH3212> yonder<WH3541> and worship<WH7812>, and come again<WH7725> to you.

And Abraham<WH85> took<WH3947> the wood<WH6086> of the burnt offering<WH5930>, and laid<WH7760> it upon Isaac<WH3327> his son<WH1121>; and he took<WH3947> the fire<WH784> in his hand<WH3027>, and a knife<WH3979>; and they went<WH3212> both<WH8147> of them together<WH3162>.

And Isaac<WH3327> spake<WH559> unto Abraham<WH85> his father<WH1>, and said<WH559>, My father<WH1>: and he said<WH559>, Here am I, my son<WH1121>. And he said<WH559>, Behold the fire<WH784> and the wood<WH6086>: but where is the lamb<WH7716> for a burnt offering<WH5930>? lamb: or, kid
And Abraham<WH85> said<WH559>, My son<WH1121>, God<WH430> will provide<WH7200> himself a lamb<WH7716> for a burnt offering<WH5930>: so they went<WH3212> both of them<WH8147> together<WH3162>.

And they came<WH935> to the place<WH4725> which God<WH430> had told<WH559> him of; and Abraham<WH85> built<WH1129> an altar<WH4196> there, and laid<WH6186> the wood<WH6086> in order<WH6186>, and bound<WH6123> Isaac<WH3327> his son<WH1121>, and laid<WH7760> him on the altar<WH4196> upon<WH4605> the wood<WH6086>.
And Abraham<WH85> stretched forth<WH7971> his hand<WH3027>, and took<WH3947> the knife<WH3979> to slay<WH7819> his son<WH1121>.
And the angel<WH4397> of the LORD<WH3068> called<WH7121> unto him out of heaven<WH8064>, and said<WH559>, Abraham<WH85>, Abraham<WH85>: and he said<WH559>, Here am I.

And he said<WH559>, Lay<WH7971> not thine hand<WH3027> upon<WH413> the lad<WH5288>, neither do thou<WH6213> any thing<WH3972> unto him: for now<WH6258> I know<WH3045> that thou fearest<WH3373> God<WH430>, seeing thou hast not<WH3808> withheld<WH2820> thy son<WH1121>, thine only<WH3173> son from me.

And Abraham<WH85> lifted up<WH5375> his eyes<WH5869>, and looked<WH7200>, and behold behind<WH310> him a ram<WH352> caught<WH270> in a thicket<WH5442> by his horns<WH7161>: and Abraham<WH85> went<WH3212> and took<WH3947> the ram<WH352>, and offered him up<WH5927> for a burnt offering<WH5930> in the stead<WH8478> of his son<WH1121>.

And Abraham<WH85> called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of that place<WH4725> Jehovahjireh<WH3070>: as<WH834> it is said<WH559> to this day<WH3117>, In the mount<WH2022> of the LORD<WH3068> it shall be seen<WH7200>. Jehovahjireh: that is, The Lord will see, or, provide
And the angel<WH4397> of the LORD<WH3068> called<WH7121> unto Abraham<WH85> out of heaven<WH8064> the second time<WH8145>,

And said<WH559>, By myself have I sworn<WH7650>, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>, for because<WH3282> <WH834> thou hast done<WH6213> this thing<WH1697>, and hast not<WH3808> withheld<WH2820> thy son<WH1121>, thine only<WH3173> son:

That in blessing<WH1288> I will bless<WH1288> thee, and in multiplying<WH7235> I will multiply<WH7235> thy seed<WH2233> as the stars<WH3556> of the heaven<WH8064>, and as the sand<WH2344> which is upon the sea<WH3220> shore<WH8193>; and thy seed<WH2233> shall possess<WH3423> the gate<WH8179> of his enemies<WH341>; shore: Heb. lip
And in thy seed<WH2233> shall all the nations<WH1471> of the earth<WH776> be blessed<WH1288>; because<WH834> <WH6118> thou hast obeyed<WH8085> my voice<WH6963>.
So Abraham<WH85> returned<WH7725> unto his young men<WH5288>, and they rose up<WH6965> and went<WH3212> together<WH3162> to Beersheba<WH884>; and Abraham<WH85> dwelt<WH3427> at Beersheba<WH884>.

And it came to pass after<WH310> these things<WH1697>, that it was told<WH5046> Abraham<WH85>, saying<WH559>, Behold, Milcah<WH4435>, she hath also born<WH3205> children<WH1121> unto thy brother<WH251> Nahor<WH5152>;
Huz<WH5780> his firstborn<WH1060>, and Buz<WH938> his brother<WH251>, and Kemuel<WH7055> the father<WH1> of Aram<WH758>,
And Chesed<WH3777>, and Hazo<WH2375>, and Pildash<WH6394>, and Jidlaph<WH3044>, and Bethuel<WH1328>.
And Bethuel<WH1328> begat<WH3205> Rebekah<WH7259>: these eight<WH8083> Milcah<WH4435> did bear<WH3205> to Nahor<WH5152>, Abraham's<WH85> brother<WH251>. Rebekah: Gr. Rebecca
And his concubine<WH6370>, whose name<WH8034> was Reumah<WH7208>, she bare<WH3205> also Tebah<WH2875>, and Gaham<WH1514>, and Thahash<WH8477>, and Maachah<WH4601>.
